availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky physician. Lived in Hancock County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Elizabeth Blincoe Holmes. Father of Benjamin M. Holmes, Lewis T. Holmes, Hester Holmes, Sophsonia Holmes, William Holmes, and Amelia Holmes. Owned six enslaved persons in 1850. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1847. A founding member of the Hancock County Agricultural Society passed during 1865-1866 Session of the Kentucky General Assembly. Member of the Masonic Order at Hancock Lodge, No. 115 in Hawesville, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Collinsâ€™ Historical Sketches of Kentucky: History of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Collins & Company, 1878), 305; "An Act to Incorporate the Hancock County Agricultural Society," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Passed at the . . . Monday, the Fourth Day of December 1865 (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 522-523; Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville, Commencing on Monday, the 21st Day of October, 1867 (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 111-112; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 36; "Dr. Timothy Holmes," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=89300716&ref=acom) (accessed on April 7, 2017).
